titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Queens County Surrogate's Office summonses 1977.597
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:16:27 +0000.

did.abstract: Two handwritten copies of a summons delivered to Martinus Van Alst of Fishkill, N.Y. instructing him to appear before the Surrogate's Office in Queens County, N.Y. for matters pertaining to the administration of the estate of George Van Alst, and the bottom portion of a summons from the Queens County Surrogate's Office to an unidentified individual regarding the administration of the estate of Nathaniel Tyler. Documents date from 1816.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Queens County Surrogate's Office summonses, 1977.597, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

controlaccess.subject: Decedents' estates |z New York (State) |z Queens County
